page.title: 20FARMING TECHNOLOGY
page.content: ON MY DAD'S FARM THERE ARE FIVE TRACTORS. HIS BIGGEST AND NEWEST IS 82 HORSE POWER. THAT MEANS IT HAS THE POWER OF 82 HORSES. DURING THE TIME OF FIVE HOURS THE TRACTOR COULD PLOUGH 1O ACRES OF ROUGH LAND USING A FOUR FURROW REVERSIBLE PLOUGH. THE COMBINE HARVESTER IS USED FOR HARVESTING CEREALS AND RAPE. IT COVERS 2O-3O ACRES A DAY. ON AVERAGE IT HARVESTS 5O-1OO TONS OF GRAIN. THE GRAIN HAS TO BE LESS THAN 2O% MOISTURE CONTENT BEFORE IT CAN BE HARVESTED. RAPE HAS TO BE 12% OR LESS IN MOISTURE CONTENT. ANOTHER MAIN CROP, SUGAR BEET, IS HARVESTED BY A SPECIAL MACHINE. IT CAN HARVEST UP TO 2O TONS OF BEET IN A DAY OR 5 ACRES. THE BEET ARE TRIMMED BY THE SAME MACHINE AND LOADED ONTO A TRACTOR-DRAWN TRAILER AT THE SIDE.
